post: 📜  #OTD in 1983, a federal judge formally vacated Fred Korematsus conviction for defying Japanese American internment during WWII. What can this teach students about justice, courage, and the Constitutions resilience? 🔗 Lesson:  https://bit.ly/47xmDFe  #TDiH  #CivilRights  #CivicVirtues  #CivicEducation  #EqualProtection

🎉 Congratulations to our first Civic Star Challenge Winners! More than 60 educators across the country earned recognition, classroom cash, and Civic Star swag for empowering their students to shine. Your class could be next, so log your civics activity today! 🔗  https://bit.ly/4oEU5iQ  #CivicStarChallenge  #CivicEducation  #TeachingCivics  #CivicEngagement  #EducationMatters

📜  #OTD in 1620, the Pilgrims sighted Cape Cod after a treacherous Atlantic voyage. Soon afterward, they drafted the Mayflower Compact to govern their new colony. How can we connect this moment to the ideas of consent, community, and self-government? 🔗 Lesson:  https://bit.ly/3XdWyVw  #TDiH  #Mayflower  #CivicEducation  #SelfGovernment  #AmericanHistory

📜  #OTD in 1637, Anne Hutchinsons civil trial concluded with her banishment from Massachusetts for challenging religious authority. How can this moment help students consider freedom of conscience and dissent in a self-governing society? 🔗 Lesson:  https://bit.ly/3LNivYU  #TDiH  #AnneHutchinson  #ReligiousFreedom  #CivicEducation  #AmericanHistory

Stand up for your state and support teachers near you. Every $1 puts a Pocket Constitution into the hands of a student learning to be a citizen. Give for your state ➡️  https://bit.ly/40EsBAg  #CivicsChampion  #CivicEducation  #StatePride  #SupportTeachers  #CommunityImpact

Should all federal employees be paid during a shutdown? Invite your students to take a side, use evidence, and practice civil discourse. Submissions due Nov 20; prizes + swag. Share with your students and weigh in below. 🔗  https://bit.ly/4nIUj7j  #CivicEducation  #StudentVoice  #CivilDiscourse  #APGov  #ThinkTheVote

2 minutes is all it takes to teach a civic moment. Add a quick Americas 250th tie‑in to the unit youre teaching now, log it, and your class is in the Civic Star Challenge with 300+ chances to win this year. Whats your easiest tie‑in this week? 🔗  https://bit.ly/3V1CQuX  #CivicStarChallenge  #CivicEducation  #America250  #Teachers

Many students are already doing MyImpact Challenge projects: tutoring younger kids, running fundraisers, and leading clubs. If youre a student making a difference, you can enter. This Veterans Day, honor those whove served and the ideals they protected. Federal Flags, LLC offers American-made flags, military flags, and flagpoles built to last. Use code BRI5 to save while supporting civic education at the Bill of Rights Institute. 🛒  https://bit.ly/3z2vhMW  #VeteransDay  #CivicEducation  #MadeInUSA  #FederalFlags  #CivicPride

📜  #OTD in 1804, Sacagawea joined the Corps of Discovery as an interpreter and guide. Her knowledge of the land and diplomacy helped shape the success of Lewis and Clarks expedition. How does her story expand our understanding of civic contribution and perseverance? 🔗 Lesson:  https://bit.ly/3sMsLUU  #TDiH  #Sacagawea  #AmericanHistory  #CivicVirtues  #CivicEducation
